event: Earliest human presence in present-day Argentina
Early agricultural societies develop in the northwest
Diaguita cultures flourish in the Andean northwest
Mapuche groups expand across southern Argentina
Inca Empire incorporates northwestern Argentina
Spanish explorers reach the Río de la Plata
First foundation of Buenos Aires
Buenos Aires is refounded as a permanent settlement
Cattle ranching shapes the Pampas economy and culture
Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata is created
May Revolution begins the independence process
Independence is declared in Tucumán
Civil wars erupt between federalist and centralist factions
National Constitution establishes the Argentine state
Argentina is unified under a national government
Buenos Aires is federalized as the national capital
Conquest of the Desert expands control over Patagonia
Centennial celebrated amid mass European immigration
First military coup ushers in political instability
Juan Domingo Perón rises to power
Military dictatorship begins
Return to democratic civilian rule
Severe economic crisis reshapes national outlook
